snippet: A break for speed racing, like similar special benefits, will cost the government millions, but supporters defended it as a tax break.
abstract: Owners of auto racetracks, with help of devoted Nascar fans in Congress and lobbyists, secure one-year extension of expiring tax break that allows them to write off investments in their property over 7 years, rather than 15 years; this break for speed racing, along with other similar special benefits granted in new tax deal, will cost government millions over next decade.

byline.original: By ROBERT PEAR and MARY PILON
byline.contributor: Robert Pear reported from Washington, and Mary Pilon from New York. Viv Bernstein contributed reporting from Charlotte, N.C.

lead_paragraph: A break for speed racing, like similar special benefits, will cost the government millions, but supporters defended it as a tax break.
